content.p: The University of Nottingham School of Biosciences is internationally recognised as a leader in the provision of research and teaching in fundamental and applied sciences for the improvement of agricultural, food quality and safety, nutrition and environmental protection. To learn more about what it's like to to study with the School of Biosciences, read our student experiences and see what our own students have to say. Our graduates are armed with the knowledge and practical skills to go on to successful careers in a variety of fields. Please visit our careers page to learn more about exciting opportunities for Bioscience graduates. Alongside our commitment to innovative teaching, our research excellence is recognised as being of international importance. The 2008 UK Research Assessment Exercise (RAE) confirmed the school's top position in our research areas. We are making the most of our presence in Malaysia and conducting major research projects into the uses of tropical plants. We currently have an industrial partnership with Applied Agricultural Resources in which we are researching oil palm. We invite you to explore our website and learn more about our programmes and research. telephone: +6 (03) 8924 8000 fax: +6 (03) 8924 8018
